statements: SELECT * FROM research_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT source, data_text FROM research_data WHERE data_date >= '2021-01-01';
SELECT data_date, source FROM research_data WHERE id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT id, source, data_date FROM research_data WHERE source LIKE '%research%';
SELECT * FROM research_data ORDER BY data_date DESC, id ASC;
SELECT * FROM research_data ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT source, data_text FROM research_data WHERE source='Source1' OR source='Source2';
SELECT * FROM research_data WHERE data_text LIKE '%keyword%' AND data_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31';
SELECT id, source, data_date FROM research_data WHERE id % 2 = 0 ORDER BY data_date ASC LIMIT 3;
SELECT id, source, data_text FROM research_data WHERE data_text IS NOT NULL ORDER BY id ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM DatasetCleaning;
SELECT dataset_name, data_source FROM DatasetCleaning WHERE dataset_name = 'Example Dataset';
SELECT dataset_id, dataset_name, data_source, cleaning_method FROM DatasetCleaning ORDER BY dataset_name DESC;
SELECT analysis_id, analysis_type FROM StatisticalAnalysis WHERE analysis_type = 'Regression';
SELECT dataset_id, dataset_name, cleaning_method, cleaned_data FROM DatasetCleaning WHERE cleaning_method = 'Manual Cleaning';
SELECT * FROM DatasetCleaning ORDER BY dataset_name DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT dataset_name, data_source FROM DatasetCleaning WHERE dataset_name LIKE '%sample%' AND cleaning_method = 'manual';
SELECT dataset_id, COUNT(analysis_id) AS num_of_analysis FROM StatisticalAnalysis GROUP BY dataset_id HAVING COUNT(analysis_id) > 1;
SELECT SUM(analysis_result->>'processing_time') AS total_processing_time FROM StatisticalAnalysis WHERE analysis_type = 'data_processing';
SELECT dataset_name, JSONB_ARRAY_ELEMENTS(cleaned_data) AS cleaned_element FROM DatasetCleaning WHERE dataset_name IN ('Dataset A', 'Dataset B') ORDER BY dataset_name;
SELECT id, dataset_id, cleaning_steps FROM DataCleaning;
SELECT cleaning_status, cleaned_data FROM DataCleaning ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT preprocessed_data FROM Preprocessing WHERE id = 3;
SELECT dataset_id, analysis_steps FROM StatisticalAnalysis WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, preprocessing_steps, processing_status FROM Preprocessing ORDER BY dataset_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM DataCleaning WHERE cleaning_status = true;
SELECT preprocessing_steps FROM Preprocessing WHERE dataset_id = 10;
SELECT id, analysis_steps FROM StatisticalAnalysis ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, dataset_id, preprocessed_data FROM Preprocessing WHERE processing_status = false;
SELECT id, dataset_id, cleaning_steps, cleaned_data FROM DataCleaning WHERE dataset_id IN (1, 3, 5) ORDER BY dataset_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM Studies;
SELECT study_name, research_field FROM Studies;
SELECT dataset_name, source, size_bytes FROM Datasets;
SELECT researcher_id, researcher_name, institution FROM Researchers;
SELECT data_id, preprocessing_steps FROM PreprocessedData;
SELECT * FROM Studies;
SELECT study_name, research_field FROM Studies WHERE research_field = 'Biology';
SELECT dataset_name, source, size_bytes FROM Datasets WHERE size_bytes > 1000000 ORDER BY size_bytes DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT institution FROM Researchers;
SELECT researcher_name, email FROM Researchers INNER JOIN PreprocessedData ON Researchers.researcher_id = PreprocessedData.data_id;
SELECT * FROM Researchers;
SELECT name, institution FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_id = 1;
SELECT dataset_id, name, source FROM Datasets WHERE source LIKE '%research%';
SELECT * FROM CleaningSteps ORDER BY step_id DESC;
SELECT preprocess_name, action FROM PreprocessingSteps WHERE preprocess_id > 3;
SELECT * FROM Researchers ORDER BY name DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT name, institution FROM Researchers WHERE institution='University' OR name LIKE '%John%';
SELECT r.name, COUNT(DISTINCT p.action) AS num_actions FROM Researchers r INNER JOIN PreprocessingSteps p ON r.researcher_id = p.preprocess_id GROUP BY r.name HAVING num_actions > 2;
SELECT dataset_id, name, source, COUNT(*) AS num_steps FROM Datasets d LEFT JOIN CleaningSteps c ON d.dataset_id = c.step_id GROUP BY dataset_id, name, source ORDER BY num_steps DESC;

SELECT DISTINCT a.analysis_name, s.technique, r.name AS researcher_name FROM StatisticalAnalysis a INNER JOIN Researchers r ON a.analysis_id = r.researcher_id INNER JOIN PreprocessingSteps p ON r.researcher_id = p.preprocess_id INNER JOIN Datasets d ON p.preprocess_id = d.dataset_id INNER JOIN CleaningSteps c ON d.dataset_id = c.step_id LEFT JOIN StatisticalAnalysis s ON c.step_id = s.analysis_id ORDER BY researcher_name ASC;
